newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Police question Jerusalem mayor in corruption case.
newsitem.headline: Police question Jerusalem mayor in corruption case.

text.p: Israeli police on Monday questioned Jerusalem Mayor Ehud Olmert in connection with an alleged government corruption case, a police spokeswoman said.
The spokeswoman said investigators took testimony from Olmert for one hour in his office. She declined to elaborate.
Itim news agency quoted Olmert as saying after the meeting his name was mentioned in the case "by accident" and he doubted he could contribute to the investigation.

Police are investigating allegations by Israel Television that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government appointed an attorney-general last month as part of a deal with a politician on trial for corruption.

The attorney-general, Roni Bar-On, quit 12 hours after taking office. The television said religious Shas party leader Aryeh Deri demanded Bar-On get the job in exchange for Shas's support for Netanyahu's accord with the PLO on Hebron.
It said Bar-On promised Deri a plea-bargain that would have let Deri continue his political career. The cabinet later approved the Hebron deal with Shas's support.
Netanyahu, Deri and Bar-On have all denied the charges.
